column5: First post!! Hey guys I was just wondering if anyone had any general info on lake Nosbonsing during august.I will be there from the 6-13th. Anything such as rigs/lures/hotspots would be greatly appreciated.
There are no fish in Nosbonsing, sorry!
there was a really good feature article on nosbonsing in ontario out of doors within the last couple of years.  perhaps its still available

There  is a fair amount of fishing reports from Nosbonsing over the years. Use the search function and type in "Nosbonsing" and many should be found like this....  http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=53298&st=0&p=579754&hl=nosbonsing&fromsearch=1entry579754
I was hoping to go for some of the pike or walleye.

For big-eye, follow the hords of boats!  They will be trolling just before the narrows on the big side.  I have had very good luck just through the narrows on the small side. Pike,  bass and even the odd muskie are pulled from the point on the north side just through the narrows.  It is a tough lake to fish but their are a good amount of fish in that lake.  Stay  around the narrows and you will have a great outing!  Good luck  P.S.  send me a PM before you go as i might just be up at the cottage and would be happy to point you in the right direction.
Thanks for the info matt and when the time comes around ill send you a PM. Do you know of any maps of the lake with depths and things like that?
Biggest pike  I've ever seen being caught was on this lake....but of course that was about 40 years ago  Where in the hell does time go?
You can only dream of pike that big these days:wallbash:
And just wondering if there is any shore fishing opportunities for my younger brother and sister, since we cant all fit in the 16ft aluminum:lol:
